Scene.Header: SCENE 2: Robby arrives at the Ryoukan

StoryElement.StoryElement: Here I am. This place is awesome! I can’t believe I’m staying here for next to nothing. I should personally thank Junko the next time I see her. If this is the lobby, I can’t wait to see the rooms! Is that a pond over there? Let’s just take a gander . . . Holy mackerel look at those koi fish! They could eat me. Speaking of which, maybe they’re hungry.
(Robby pulls out some crackers from his bag)
HOTEL CLERK: Excuse me! What are you doing?

StoryInteraction.StoryInteraction: ROBBY: Uh nothing, I was just counting my crackers.

StoryElement.StoryElement: Wow even the staff is beautiful.

StoryResponse.StoryResponse: HOTEL CLERK: It looked like you were going to feed the fish. I’m sorry but we don’t allow that.
HOTEL CLERK: That’s OK. We feed the fish a special food. Anything else might make them sick.

StoryElement.StoryElement: ROBBY: Oh, I gotcha.
HOTEL CLERK: Will you be staying with us, sir?
ROBBY: Yes, in fact a friend recommended this place to me. You wouldn’t happen to know Junko would you?
HOTEL CLERK: Jun chan?
ROBBY: No, JunKO. KO as in “KOala”
Jesus, is my pronunciation that bad?
HOTEL CLERK: You must be Robby! Junko told me all about you.

StoryInteraction.StoryInteraction: Did she tell you I was handsome?
Did she tell you I was a crazy fish feeder?

StoryElement.StoryElement: ROBBY: Sorry to disappoint you.
HOTEL CLERK (laughs) That’s OK. My name is Mariko.
MariKO . . . JunKO, I must work on my pronunciation.
ROBBY: It’s nice to meet you, Mariko. Let’s run away together. Somewhere nice where the Koi eat crackers. Mariko, will you marry me!
MARIKO (laughs) Junko said you were kind of strange. But in a good way.
I could listen to that laugh all day.
ROBBY: Seriously thanks for getting me in here. So far my first trip to Japan has been absolutely perfect.
ROBBY: Don’t worry, I think I can blend in.
MARIKO: That’s OK. Just relax and enjoy your stay.
ROBBY: I plan to do a lot of relaxing. Where is my room? Can you show me?
MARIKO: I would love to but I’m very busy. I have to go!
ROBBY: Oh come on, you can take a little time to show me my room, can’t you?
MARIKO: I’m sorry. My manager is watching us. I have to help with room service. I’ll see you later.
ROBBY: Sounds great. Good luck.
There she goes. Busy, busy, busy . . . Now, to check out my room.
